intro: Iria oxystachya, commonly known as the narrow-leaved iria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Iria oxystachya is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
